structural_unit_name.en: Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies

description.en: Master's seminar takes place in the autumn and spring semesters of the second study year. Learning will be organised in the e-seminar format. In autumn semester seminars, the students will present their research plans (incl. research question, theoretical framework, research methodology, and expected findings), answer questions about their research plans, and discuss the research plans of fellow students. In spring, the students will participate in a mock defence of their MA thesis draft.
description.et: Magistriseminar toimub teise õppeaasta sügis- ja kevadsemestril. Õppetöö viiakse läbi e-seminari vormis. Sügissemestri seminarides tutvustavad üliõpilased oma magistritöö kavandit (sh uurimisküsimus, teoreetiline raamistik, uurimismetoodika ja oodatavad tulemused), vastavad küsimustele kavandi kohta ja arutavad teiste üliõpilaste kavandeid. Kevadsemestril toimub magistritöö proovikaitsmine.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to aid students in their thesis writing process. Using practical exercises, the course advances students' skills in conducting, presenting, critically assessing and discussing academic research, and thereby supports the successful completion of the MA thesis.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on aidata tudengeid lõputööde kirjutamisel. Kasutades praktilisi harjutusi, arendab kursus üliõpilaste oskusi akadeemiliste uuringute läbiviimisel, esitamisel, kriitilisel hindamisel ja arutamisel ning toetab seeläbi magistritöö edukat lõpetamist.

learning_outcomes.en: Students completing the course will (1) have improved their ability to plan their work; (2) be able to formulate a relevant, well-justified and original research question and choose an appropriate research design to answer that question; (3) be able to link theoretical approaches to research methods and empirical analysis; (4) be able to present analytical, structured and well-substantiated arguments, and (5) be familiar with principles of academic writing and code of conduct for academic research.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbinud õpilased (1) on parandanud oma oskusi oma tööd planeerida; 2) on võimelised sõnastama asjakohase, hästi põhjendatud ja originaalse uurimisküsimuse ning valima sellele küsimusele vastamiseks sobiva uurimiskava; (3) oskavad siduda teoreetilisi lähenemisviise uurimismeetodite ja empiirilise analüüsiga; 4) on võimelised esitama analüütilisi, struktureeritud ja põhjendatud argumente ning 5) tunnevad akadeemilise kirjutamise põhimõtteid ja head teadustava.

independent_work.et:
In autumn:
1) Writing a 2-page outline of proposed MA thesis (see written guidelines above)
2) Oral presentation of the thesis outline in seminar

In spring:
1) Writing an MA thesis draft, ca 80% of the final thesis (see written guidelines above)
2) Presentation of the thesis draft at mock defence

grade_preconditions.et:
In autumn:
1) Submitting a 2-page written outline of proposed MA thesis
2) Oral presentation of the thesis outline in seminar
3) Active participation in seminar through answering to and asking questions

In spring:
1) Submitting an MA thesis draft (ca 80% of the final thesis)
2) Oral presentation of the thesis draft in mock defence
3) Active participation in seminar through answering to and asking questions

grade_evaluation.et:
In autumn:
1) Submitting a 2-page written outline of proposed MA thesis
2) Oral presentation of the thesis outline in seminar
3) Active participation in seminar through answering to and asking questions

In spring:
1) Submitting an MA thesis draft (ca 80% of the final thesis)
2) Oral presentation of the thesis draft in a mock defence
3) Active participation in seminar through answering to and asking questions

To pass the course, all three steps must be successfully accomplished.

resources.mandatory_materials:
"Requirements for final theses, forming of the defence committee, appointment of a reviewer, and for the defence and second defence at the Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies."

The document is available at 
https://skytte.ut.ee/sites/default/files/2022-03/Requirements%20for%20final%20theses%2C%20defence%20committee%2C%20reviewer%2C%20and%20the%20defence%20at%20the%20JS%20Institute.pdf
